Its head is often carved to resemble a helmet or the head of some beast.While it may be sculpted to carry a stone shield or stone weapon such as asword, these aesthetic choices don’t affect its combat abilities.

A stone golem can’t speak—it makes no sound other than the grinding of stoneagainst stone when it moves.

Storm Giant.name: Storm Giant
Storm Giant.description:
Storm giants tend toward tanned complexions, though some rare specimens haveviolet skin, deep violet or blue-black hair, and silvery gray or purpleeyes. Such violet coloration is considered to be good luck among stormgiants, and those possessing it tend to become leaders among theirkind.Adults typically stand 21 feet tall and weigh almost 12,000 pounds.

Storm giants tend to be reclusive, preferring to dwell along remotecoastlines or on tropical islands. They are prone to violent mood swings,and are quick to anger in the face of evil. They are brutal and dangerousfoes when insulted.

Succubus.name: Succubus
Succubus.description: Among the demon hordes, a succubus can often rise to incredible heights ofpower via her manipulations and sensual charms. Many a demonic war has ragedbecause of the subtle machinations of these demons. A succubus is formedfrom the souls of particularly lustful and rapacious evil mortals.

Swarm.name: Swarm
Swarm.description:
Sometimes the most deadly foes come in the smallest packages. The swarmdescribed here can consist of most anything—from biting ants to stingingwasps to filthy rats. They cover an area equal to a Large, Medium, or Small @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Blast Template} and attack everyone within it every round. When a swarm is Incapacitated it’s effectively dispersed.

Swarms aren’t intelligent enough to do anything but move and bite andshouldn’t take Multi-Actions, make Tests, etc.

Taiga Giant.name: Taiga Giant
Taiga Giant.description:
These nomadic hunters wander the northern reaches of Avistan and Casmaron.They patiently follow herds of auroch, mammoths, and other creatures. Theyusually avoid humanoid settlements, although they sometimes raid towns orvillages when prey is scarce.

Large even for giantkind—20 feet tall and almost 10,000 pounds­—taigagiants decorate themselves with tattoos, jewelry, and spirit fetishes. Theyare fond of music and song.

Tarn Linnorm.name: Tarn Linnorm
Tarn Linnorm.description:
This nightmarishly gargantuan linnorm possesses two equally fearsome heads.Its twin jaws seethe with acid and poison.

Although legends speak of even more powerful linnorms, it’s hard to believeafter witnessing the devastation a two-headed tarn linnorm can wreak.Content to sleep away the centuries at the bottom of dark, deep mountainlakes, a tarn is a true horror feared by even the mightiest of heroes onGolarion.

Tarrasque.name: Tarrasque
Tarrasque.description:
The legendary tarrasque is among Golarion’s most destructive monsters.Thankfully, it spends most of its time in a deep torpor in an unknown cavernin a remote corner of the world. Yet when it wakens, kingdoms perish.

Although far from intelligent, the tarrasque is smart enough to understand afew words in Aklo. Likewise, it isn’t mindless in its rampages, but insteadfocuses on targets that threaten it. The tarrasque is difficult to distractwith trickery.

Tatzlwyrm.name: Tatzlwyrm
Tatzlwyrm.description:
Slithering like a large snake, this creature has the head of a dragon and apair of clawed arms to help with movement and grappling. A sickly greenmists wafts from its open maw.

Tatzlwryms spend most of their time lying in wait for prey, whether animalor humanoid. They hoard the remains of their hunts even though they have nouse for the treasure. The eldest accumulate morbid troves of bones, debris,and valuables. These creatures often dwell in dense forests or undergroundcaverns. They are known to favor Darkwood forests, in particular.

Tendriculos.name: Tendriculos
Tendriculos.description:
A tendriculos is a creature brought into being through a corruption ofnature. This is often a result of foul magic concentrated in a particulararea. Sometimes, these creatures manifest from places where the boundariesbetween the Material @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04theplanes00000]{Plane} and the mysterious realm of the fey have wornthin.

The plant creature’s thick trunk is capped by a crown of wide leaves,whipping vines, mushrooms, and a ravenous purple maw. It is a voracious anddangerous hunter, preferring to ambush prey.

Tentamort.name: Tentamort
Tentamort.description:
This monster looks something like a leathery, eyeless squid with a squatbody the size of a rain barrel. Its lower body splits into a tangle oftentacles the creature uses to slowly move. Meanwhile, two longertentacles—one thick and muscular, the other lithe and tipped with a bonestinger—emerge from either side of its upper body.

Tentamorts live in marshes or in underground caverns near water sources.These patient predators usually wait for prey to come to them, relying ontheir poison and quickness.

Townsfolk.name: Townsfolk
Townsfolk.description:
This profile covers everything from farmers, to merchants, and artisans.They are everyday folks, not soldiers or town guards.

Their attributes and skills may vary as needed. For example, artisansprobably have Repair d6, while a stableboy probably has Riding d4. Theirgear represents only what might be in hand whenever any unplanned combattakes place. Townsfolk rarely wear armor.

Treant.name: Treant
Treant.description:
Treants are guardians of the forest and speakers for the trees. Aslong-lived as the forests themselves, they are slow and methodical in mostthings but formidable when compelled to fight. They excel at tearing downwhat others build and they have an inherent dislike of loggers.

Treants are primarily solitary creatures, although they occasionally gatherto share information and reproduce. In grave and rare times, treants convenea moot, which may last for months on end.

These animated trees have knotted bark with vaguely humanoid features. Theytend to resemble the species of trees most common in their woodlandterritories—from the jungles of Garund, to Fangwood Forest in Nirmathas, andthe Verduran Forest in Avistan.

Troglodyte.name: Troglodyte
Troglodyte.description:
Troglodytes are feral cave dwellers with scaly gray bodies like that of cavelizards. They are among the most populous denizens of the upper reaches ofthe endless caverns of the underworld, raiding the settlements of those whodwell above or below ground.

Troglodytes are one of the oldest of the intelligent peoples. Ruins found insome remote caverns testify to the fact that their empire was once among thelargest in the world. At the dawn of recorded history, troglodytecivilization was generations ahead of other humanoids.

Troll.name: Troll
Troll.description:
Trolls are large humanoids with greenish hide, sharp claws, and bestialfaces. Their stooped posture belies their size—14 feet tall and 1,000pounds—but doesn’t diminish their formidable presence.

Trolls regenerate quickly, unless the damage inflicted is fire oracid-based. They deliver powerful blows with their claws, though they arealso capable of Fighting with weapons.

The creatures dwell in the wild areas of the Inner Sea region, most commonlyin northern Avistan. In most troll societies, the males are solitary huntersand wanders, while the females and children live in extended family groups.

Trumpet Archon.name: Trumpet Archon
Trumpet Archon.description:
Lithe and beautiful, with skin the color of marble, this heavenly archonhovers upon powerful white wings. It radiates a sense of serenity and goodtidings.

These messengers of good deities and mighty celestials serve as the vanguardof divine armies. Trumpet archons often act as intermediaries between thegods and mortals. They speak with clear, musical voices.

All trumpet archons carry a gleaming magical horn. They use their trumpetsto create wondrous music, paralyze enemies, and call other archons to thedefense of just causes.

Unicorn.name: Unicorn
Unicorn.description:
Unicorns are fierce, intelligent creatures of the forest, noble beasts whokeep their own counsel and typically appear only to defend their homesagainst evil.

They universally shun all creatures except for good-aligned fey,good-aligned humanoid women, and the woodlands’ native animals, though theymay fight alongside other good creatures against common enemies. A typicalunicorn is 8 feet long and 5 feet tall at the shoulder, weighing 1,200pounds.

Vampire.name: Vampire
Vampire.description:
Vampires are intelligent undead creatures. They feeds off the blood of theliving in order to prolong their own unnatural existence.

Vampires came to Golarion from the @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04theplanes00000]{Plane} of Shadow long ago. Exactly howthey arrived remains lost to history and is a matter of debate in scholarlycircles. Over time, these “true vampires” have spawned many more.

Amongst their own kind, true vampires use the slang term full-blood todistinguish themselves from those they consider lesser but associatedbeings, such as vampire spawn.

Vargouille.name: Vargouille
Vargouille.description:
Originally from the lower @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04theplanes00000]{planes}, these creatures are grotesque flying headswith bat-like wings. Despite their otherworldly origins, they turn up on theMaterial Plane, especially in Andoran, Kaer Maga, and the Mwangi Expanse.

Typically, vargouilles lurk or lair near old Battlefields, graveyards, orother locations visited by death. Evil spellcasters summon these creaturesto Golarion from time to time. Their putrid kiss transforms their victimsinto vargouilles.

Venomous.name: Venomous
Venomous.description: These stats cover a variety of medium-sized snakes with extremely deadlypoison. Such venomous snakes usually live solitary lives, although it’spossible to stumble into a nest of poisonous vipers.

Violet Fungus.name: Violet Fungus
Violet Fungus.description:
This human-sized fungus grows from a bed of tentacular roots. Deep violettendrils slither out of the dozens of fissures in its pointed cap. It isusually found in a small grove of up to a dozen fungi.

The carnivorous violet fungus is one of the most notorious and feareddangers of Golarion’s Darklands. It feeds on the rot and decay of organicmatter. A violet fungus’s tendrils are coated with a virulent @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04hazards0000000]{venom}. Theseplants can move, but they usually stay rooted in one place as long as theyhave rotting organic matter to sustain them.

Vrock.name: Vrock
Vrock.description:
Profane champions of the Abyss, vrocks embody all the rage, hatred, andviolence of that despicable realm. As ravenous and grotesquely opportunisticas the avian scavengers they resemble, vrocks delight in bloodshed,relishing the sounds and sensations of ripping the still-pulsing entrailsfrom a living husk.

Vrocks usually form from the evil souls of hateful and wrathful mortals,particularly criminals, mercenaries, or assassins.

Water Elemental.name: Water Elemental
Water Elemental.description: This translucent creature’s shape shifts between a spinning column of waterand a crashing wave.

Water Elemental, Elder.name: Water Elemental, Elder
Water Elemental, Elder.description: This translucent creature’s shape shifts between a spinning column of waterand a crashing wave.

Water Elemental, Small.name: Water Elemental, Small
Water Elemental, Small.description: This translucent creature’s shape shifts between a spinning column of waterand a crashing wave.

Water Mephit.name: Water Mephit
Water Mephit.description:
Mephits are the servants of powerful elemental creatures. Key sites andlocations on the elemental planes are full of mephits scurrying about onimportant errands or duties.

Each kind of mephit is associated with one element that defines its specialabilities. This is the base profile, followed by Special Abilities for eachmephit.

Wendigo.name: Wendigo
Wendigo.description:
A wendigo appears much like a tall humanoid in the last stages of death fromstarvation. Completely hairless, its flesh is deathly pale except for itsblackened extremities. Its fingers end with long talons, while needle-likefangs fill its mouth.

A wendigo has ragged, bloody flesh around its maw because it constantlydevours its own lips. Its tongue is long, pocked with sores, and the colorof a fresh bruise. It has glowing, yellow eyes that float in large socketsfull of blood.

Wererat (Hybrid Form).name: Wererat (Hybrid Form)
Wererat (Hybrid Form).description:
Whether naturally born or cursed with lyncanthropy, wererats areshapechangers feared by anyone with common sense. They tend to keep theirabilities a secret known only to others in their hidden guilds.

Natural wererats usually look like short and wiry humans—often with anervous disposition and darting rodent-like eyes—when in human form. Thosecursed with this existence appear exactly as they did before they becameinfected. Both can take a hybrid form as well as that of a giant rat.

Werewolf (Hybrid Form).name: Werewolf (Hybrid Form)
Werewolf (Hybrid Form).description:
In their humanoid form, natural werewolves look like normal people, thoughsome tend to look a bit feral and have wild hair. Eyebrows that growtogether, index fingers longer than the middle fingers, and strangebirthmarks on the palm of the hand are all commonly accepted indications ofa werewolf.

Of all the lycanthropes, the werewolf is the most widespread and the mostfeared. Stories of werewolves haunting lonely forest roads, prowling mistymoors on the outskirts of rural societies, or dwelling in the shadows of thelargest cities are quite common.

White Dragon.name: White Dragon
White Dragon.description: This dragon’s scales are a frosty white. Its head is crowned with slenderhorns, with a thin membrane stretched between them.

Wight.name: Wight
Wight.description: Wights are animated corpses, resembling a cross between ghouls and spectres.Their eyes burn with hatred, and they have a hunger for the souls of theliving. For some, earthly desires or material bonds cause their spirits toremain behind to guard a treasure or their place of death. Others servewhomever brought them to unlife. Wights are sometimes found underwater, incaves or shipwrecks.

Will-o’-Wisp.name: Will-o’-Wisp
Will-o’-Wisp.description:
These strange aberrations live in swamps throughout Golarion, although noone is certain why they prefer such environments. Most commonly, they areencountered in the River Kingdoms, where they sometimes gather in smallgroups.

Will-o’-wisps appear as floating lights often mistaken as lanterns orbeacons by travelers. The creatures attempt to lure such travelers into deepmarshes and quicksand, or even to the lairs of other creatures. They do thisin hopes of feeding on the fear of dying victims. They can deliver ashocking attack, but they prefer to feed on victims who can’t fight back.

Wolf, Dire.name: Wolf, Dire
Wolf, Dire.description: These large and feral canines are often used by orcs as attack dogs. Theymay also be found roaming in packs in the deepest, darkest woods.

Wolverine.name: Wolverine
Wolverine.description:
This muscular omnivore resembles a bear cub but smells more like a skunk.Known for its ferocity, a wolverine is often a solitary animal, though amale may have a few females in his territory.

Wolverines have thick, oily fur, and sharp crampon-like claws, perfect forclimbing.

Wolverine, Dire.name: Wolverine, Dire
Wolverine, Dire.description: A dire wolverine is as large as a bear, its jaws and claws oversized andbrutal, its eyes dark and filled with rage. Even more territorial than theirsmaller relatives, they defend their lairs to the death.

Woolly Rhinoceros.name: Woolly Rhinoceros
Woolly Rhinoceros.description:
This large rhinoceros has a shaggy pelt of long, brown fur and a row ofimmense horns on its snout and brow. Unlike its non-woolly cousin, thisherbivore usually grazes for food rather than browsing on larger, fibrousplants. They tend to dwell in herds on the plains of colder climates.

Whenever these temperamental beasts perceive a threat (real or imagined),they issue loud bellows and stomp their feet as a prelude to charging andattacking.

Worg.name: Worg
Worg.description:
These intelligent and evil creatures are a magical species of wolves. Largerthan their animal cousins, they often hunt in packs, typically lead by analpha worg who dominates the other members of the pack.

Unlike their cousins, worgs possess the power of speech —and guile. Theysometimes make alliances with goblins and other evil humanoids.

Wraith.name: Wraith
Wraith.description: Wraiths are undead creatures born of evil and darkness. They hate light andliving things, as they have lost much of their connection to their formerlives. The vile creatures appear as little more than dark shapes with twoflickering pinpoints of light where their eyes should be.

Wyvern.name: Wyvern
Wyvern.description:
Wyverns are two-legged dragons. They have no fiery breath, but possess longnecks, sharp teeth, and a poisonous stinger in their tail.

Wyverns are territorial, aggressive, and impatient creatures. Unlike some oftheir dragon cousins, they have no interest in diplomacy or subtlety. Theyare quick to resort to force to accomplish their selfish goals.

Xill.name: Xill
Xill.description:
Evil and alien, these flame-red humanoids are a strange mix of insect andreptile, with four arms and fanged mandibles.

Xills have only one purpose: to perpetuate themselves at the expense ofothers. All xills are female and capable of fertilizing their own eggs, butthey require living hosts as incubators. A xill injects eggs into paralyzedvictims via a grotesque ovipositor behind their mandibles. They prefer phasespiders as hosts.

Xills are the scourge of the Ethereal @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04theplanes00000]{Plane}. These plane-shifters possessimpressive intelligence and a totalitarian, militaristic culture all theirown. They sometimes come to the Material Plane to find hosts.

Xorn.name: Xorn
Xorn.description:
This squat beast is as wide as it is tall. Strangely symmetrical, a xorn hasthree arms, three legs, three eyes, and one huge mouth. It typically growsto 8 feet in height, but older and larger specimens exist.

Xorns are outsiders from the elemental @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04theplanes00000]{plane} of Earth. They travel to Golarion’s Darklands to find and eat precious metals and gemstones. Xorns have little interest in native species, unless they happen to carry favorite meals. Xorns are known to accept bribes to avoid a fight or to provide temporary aid underground.

Xorn elders and leaders often have @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Class Abilities]{Class Edges}. @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Rogue]{Rogue} and @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Barbarian]{Barbarian} are most common.

Yeth hound.name: Yeth hound
Yeth hound.description:
These emaciated creatures resemble canines, though they originate from thelower planes. More importantly, the strange hounds have magical powers,including the ability to fly.

Yeth Hounds sometimes serve evil humanoids or other masters, such as demons.They travel in pairs or wander in packs in the darkest parts of Golarion,such as the Anferita Wood of Cheliax.

Yeti.name: Yeti
Yeti.description:
Large, white-haired humanoids, Yeti are sometimes called abominable snowmen,although it’s unclear whether that mythical label is accurate or a misnomer.

These intelligent, Stealthy creatures live in mountain ranges across Avistanas well as the icy landscapes of the Crown of the World. Typically, theyform small tribes but are rarely seen in groups—it is more likely to spot asolitary Yeti, who might easily evade any attempts to follow it.
